settings.content: Theme settings allow designers to provide an easy way for any user to customize the look and feel of their shop without having to delve into HTML or CSS code. Please see our [help page on theme settings](http://docs.shopify.com/themes/theme-templates/settings) to learn more about how you can make the theme customizable.

settings.label: Sticky menu
settings.info: Check this option to make the menu sticky. Incompatible with the , 'Vertical ' menu. Sticky do not working on mobile devices.If the menu will be is sticky on mobile devices when you open it - you can not click on the last item, because it will always be outside the screen.

settings.label: Dropdowns Animation
settings.info: Select the type of animation to displaying dropdowns. Warning: Animation correctly works only in the latest versions of progressive browsers.

settings.content: Please choose your iamge if you check Enable.
Settting for slider product single tab

settings.label: Number item
settings.info: This variable allows you to set the maximum amount of items displayed at a time with the widest browser width

settings.label: Number itemsDesktop
settings.info: This allows you to preset the number of slides visible with a particular browser width. The format is [x,y] whereby x=browser width and y=number of slides displayed. For example [1199,4] means that if(window<=1199){ show 4 slides per page} Alternatively use itemsDesktop: false to override these settings.

settings.label: Number itemsTablet
settings.info: This allows you to preset the number of slides visible with a particular browser width. The format is [x,y] whereby x=browser width and y=number of slides displayed. For example [768,2] means that if(window<=768){ show 2 slides per page} Alternatively use itemsTablet: false to override these settings.

settings.label: Number itemsMobile
settings.info: This allows you to preset the number of slides visible with a particular browser width. The format is [x,y] whereby x=browser width and y=number of slides displayed. For example [479,1] means that if(window<=479){ show 1 slides per page} Alternatively use itemsTablet: false to override these settings.
